channel.title: Monkey Minigame
channel.description:
ok so i wanna make a minigame that gives you a dragon scimmy. First, you need to kill 120 monkey guards and then the scimmy appears in your inventory. I can't think of any codes, i know its gonna be something like "addItem(ID AMOUNT)" but i just cant think of the code.. soz im not that good at coding and yeah... so if anyone can please generate a code for me i'd greatly appreciate it.
Thanks

item.title: Monkey Minigame
item.dc:creator: @00rYn00 00rYn00
item.description:
@00rYn00 wrote:

oh I was checking on my server and you will probably also need
checkMonkeyIsDead int or something like that, and that would make it to where when you killed a monkey, it would add +1 to your monkeyKills… so heres what you need…

The Arena with monkeys in it
The Main Monkey that gives you your D-Skimmy, or tells you how many monkey kills you have
A “monkeyKills” static int that keeps track of how many monkeys you’ve killed
A “checkIfMonkeyIsDead” int that adds +1 to your monkeyKills
And a lot of stuff in autospawn.cfg and if you want to block off your area you would modify some makeGlobalObjects…

but yeah I could help you if you want to with the coding part, but I would have to look up some more stuff…

Read full topic

item.title: Monkey Minigame
item.dc:creator: @kupo kupo
item.description:
@kupo wrote:

  1. You’ll need a way to tell when a monkey is killed, in npcs.java find dying emotes, somewhere in there add

if(NPCID == ###) { c.monkeyKills++; }

In client, you’ll need the static int monkeyKills.

  1. Rewarding the scimmy, either plop it in process with everything else (bad) or have them collect it from something like thechest suggested above

Note: for moreinfo, you’ll need to add it into savemoreinfo() and loadmoreinfo() I think, but that canbe looked up

Read full topic

because I think it actually will work

item.title: Monkey Minigame
item.dc:creator: @00rYn00 00rYn00
item.description:
@00rYn00 wrote:

okay fine then! don’t make your monkey minigame look like a quest… you could do this too…


//make a public int called monkey kills....

public int monkeyKills();

PUT HOWEVER YOU WANT THE MONKEY KILLS TO BE SET UP AS



then go down and add


if (monkeyKills = 120) {

    DO THE SAME THING THAT I SAID BEFORE....

however it might give them like a full inventory of the d-skimmy
but yeah I usually don’t make many public int’s and I think it might actually be a public boolean, but still, I’m not 100% percent sure thats how you would do it, but I know it’s somewhere in the ballpark…

Read full topic

item.title: Monkey Minigame
item.dc:creator: @pk3r_john pk3r john
item.description:
@pk3r_john wrote:

[quote=“00rYn00, post:2, topic:228192”]well I know a simpler way that would make it look more like a quest/minigame thing… you could have “monkeyKills” in the more-info folder, and then make a chest that does…

case CHEST ID HERE =



if (monkeyKills = 120) {

         addItem (ITEMID, ITEMAMMOUNT);
         sendMessage("Congrats on killing those darn monkeys! here's a Dragon Scimitar");

     } else {

        sendMessage("You need to kill more monkey guards);   // or you could add  
       //sendMessage(You have only killed" +monkeyKills+ "you need to kill some more);

or something like that…[/quote]

THANKS ALOT!
but do i put monkeyKills in the moreinfo folder just alone? without anything in it?

Read full topic
